verses.verse: So the nations shall (1 Kin. 8:43) fear the name of the LORD, And all the kings of the earth Your glory.
For the LORD shall build up Zion; ((Is. 60:1, 2)) He shall appear in His glory.
(Neh. 1:6; Ps. 22:24) He shall regard the prayer of the destitute, And shall not despise their prayer.
This will be (Deut. 31:19; (Rom. 15:4; 1 Cor. 10:11)) written for the generation to come, That (Ps. 22:31) a people yet to be created may praise the LORD.
For He (Deut. 26:15; Ps. 14:2) looked down from the height of His sanctuary; From heaven the LORD viewed the earth,
(Ps. 79:11) To hear the groaning of the prisoner, To release those appointed to death,
To (Ps. 22:22) declare the name of the LORD in Zion, And His praise in Jerusalem,
((Is. 2:2, 3; 49:22, 23; 60:3); Zech. 8:20-23) When the peoples are gathered together, And the kingdoms, to serve the LORD.
He weakened my strength in the way; He (Job 21:21) shortened my days.
((Ps. 39:13); Is. 38:10) I said, “O my God, Do not take me away in the midst of my days; (Job 36:26; (Ps. 90:2); Hab. 1:12) Your years are throughout all generations.
((Gen. 1:1; Neh. 9:6; Heb. 1:10-12)) Of old You laid the foundation of the earth, And the heavens are the work of Your hands.

(Is. 34:4; 51:6; Matt. 24:35; (2 Pet. 3:7, 10-12); Rev. 20:11) They will perish, but You will endure; Yes, they will all grow old like a garment; Like a cloak You will change them, And they will be changed.
But ((Is. 41:4; 43:10; Mal. 3:6; Heb. 13:8); James 1:17) You are the same, And Your years will have no end.
(Ps. 69:36) The children of Your servants will continue, And their descendants will be established before You.”
(Praise for the LORD’s Mercies) A Psalm of David. ([1]) Bless the LORD, O my soul; And all that is within me, bless His holy name!
Bless the LORD, O my soul, And forget not all His benefits:
(Ps. 130:8; Is. 33:24) Who forgives all your iniquities, Who ((Ex. 15:26); Ps. 147:3; (Is. 53:5); Jer. 17:14) heals all your diseases,
Who redeems your life from destruction, ((Ps. 5:12)) Who crowns you with lovingkindness and tender mercies,
Who satisfies your mouth with good things, So that ((Is. 40:31)) your youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
The LORD executes righteousness And justice for all who are oppressed.
(Ex. 33:12-17; Ps. 147:19) He made known His ways to Moses, His acts to the children of Israel.
((Ex. 34:6, 7; Num. 14:18); Deut. 5:10; Neh. 9:17; Ps. 86:15; Jer. 32:18; Jon. 4:2; James 5:11) The LORD is merciful and gracious, Slow to anger, and abounding in mercy.
